floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: River levels remain high as a result of the heavy, persistent rainfall yesterday, 13/05/21. Further showery rainfall is forecast today, 14/05/21, and so the Flood Alert remains in force.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today. Areas most at risk are the Horner Water, Rivers Aller and Washford, and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Visit the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated on Saturday 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Axe has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. Heavy showers will cross the area throughout Friday and overnight into Saturday. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Exe, River Batherm, River Lowman, River Haddeo

items.message:
The persistent rain across Devon has slowly cleared during Friday morning. Heavy showers are forecast to develop in some locations throughout the afternoon. A band of rain will move across the area late Friday into Saturday morning clearing to leave showers in the afternoon.  
River levels are currently steady or falling in most areas, but will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is still possible, although no flooding to properties is currently forecast.
Take care near the areas of concern and check your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area, checking for, and clearing blockages,in this location. This message will be updated on Saturday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
The persistent rain across Devon has slowly cleared during Friday morning. Heavy showers are forecast to develop in some locations throughout the afternoon. A band of rain will move across the area late Friday into Saturday morning, clearing to leave showers in the afternoon.  
River levels are currently steady or falling in most areas, but will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is still possible, although no flooding to properties is currently forecast.
Take care near the areas of concern and check your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels, and have staff in the area, checking for, and clearing blockages, in this location. This message will be updated on Saturday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels remain high as a result of heavy, persistent rainfall yesterday, 13/05/21. Further showery rainfall is forecast today, 14/05/21, and so the Flood Alert remains in force. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible. Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  This message will be updated tomorrow, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Hillfarrance Brook, Halsewater Stream, River Tone

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  

Further light showers are forecast for today but river levels are not expected to reach the Flood Alert threshold.  We will continue to monitor the situation closely.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.  Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.description: Doniford Stream in the Sampford Mill Farm area
items.message:
This Flood Warning has been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding may still affect roads and low lying land.  

We continue to monitor the situation.  Some further showery rainfall is forecast today, but we do not expect river levels to reach the Flood Warning threshold. Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.  Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Rivers in the Forest of Dean
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further unsettled weather is forecast over the weekend.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

River levels are currently steady or falling in most areas, but will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is still possible, although no flooding to properties is currently forecast.

River levels have peaked at the Cappenham river gauge following yesterday’s persistent rainfall. Flooding of roads, car parks and farmland remain possible today Friday 14th May. There is a possibility of flooding for the River Tove from Towcester to Cosgrove, including Silverstone Brook. Flooding of properties is not forecast. Some further rainfall is likely over the weekend with isolated heavy showers possible. We expect river levels to fall steadily until further rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid low lying roads and car parks near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Great Ouse in Northamptonshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire
items.message: River levels have peaked at the Brackley river gauge following yesterday’s persistent rainfall.  Flooding of roads and farmland remain possible today Friday 14th May. There is a possibility of flooding for the River Great Ouse from Brackley to Haversham, including Padbury Brook. Flooding of properties is not forecast. Some further rainfall is likely over the weekend with isolated heavy showers possible. We expect river levels to fall steadily until further rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dene in South East Warwickshire
Langford and Wendlebury Brooks from Stratton Audley down to near Merton

floodArea.riverOrSea: Audley Brook, Langford Brook, Pingle Stream, Bure, Wendlebury Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the Langford and Wendlebury Brooks as a result of persistent heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from midday 14/05/2021, especially in the Langford Village area. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
The forecast today is mostly dry, with some showers possible this afternoon. We expect river levels to remain high over the next couple of days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this evening, 14/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Ludlow (Corve) river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall over Thursday night.  
Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this Friday afternoon.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Predicted peaks:-   River Corve 2.6m to 2.7m Friday afternoon 14/05/21. No other flooding is expected in other gauged locations in this area.

Further showers are forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until Friday evening.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 5:00pm on 14/05/21, or as the situation changes.
